item.title: Docker getting started
item.description: What is Docker? Docker is a set of platform-as-a-service products that use OS-level virtualization to deliver software in packages called containers. Containers are isolated from one another and bundle their own software, libraries and configuration files; they can communicate with each other through well-defined channels. What is a container? A container is a standard unit of software that packages up code and all its dependencies so the application runs quickly and reliably from one computing environment to another.
